duties_responsibilities.duty: Oversee operations of the Benefits Analysis Department, leveraging data to drive strategic decision-making and optimize business operations.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams in collecting, analyzing, and visualizing data to uncover valuable insights for Executives and Trustees.
Maintain a thorough understanding of the benefits and business processes of the Basic and Supplemental Pension Plans and the Health Plan.
Develop statistical models and perform model updates as needed.
Identify cost-effective benefit initiatives and programs based on current environment and best practices.
Ensure timely and accurate business-related analytics to support annual reporting and compliance with legislative and regulatory mandates.
Oversee claims auditor and review audit reports for accuracy in conjunction with the Claims Department Manager and Controller.
Audit pension and health benefits payments through analysis of data to ensure accuracy and initiate recommendations for process improvements.
Perform any other functions as required to meet the business analysis needs of the Plans.
Maintain regular, predictable, and reliable attendance.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in business or related field with 5+ years’ experience in data analysis and use of analytical tools (i.e., SAS, Microsoft Power BI or Tableau). Certified Employee Benefits Specialist degree or comparative coursework related to multi-employer trust funds administration is preferred.
